name: interworking
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact or process of computer equipment and software being able to connect and exchange information, or an example of this: In these configurations, interworking is enabled by default. This function makes possible the interworking of different IP networks. Explain the interworkings of a cellular network from a hardware point of view.
More examplesFewer examplesThis facilitates interworking of existing infrastructure (e.g. hardware and software) for use with the wireless LAN equipment. The product provided interworking between databases on these systems.Calls will execute correctly regardless of whether the target code has been compiled for interworking or not.Embedded.com has a nice piece explaining the basic interworkings of symmetric multiprocessing (SMP).
